How to Install libmyproxy-voms on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • libmyproxy-voms

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install libmyproxy-voms on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing libmyproxy-voms on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall libmyproxy-voms in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install libmyproxy-voms, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install libmyproxy-voms Using apt

To install libmyproxy-voms in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install libmyproxy-voms using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install libmyproxy-voms

The installation of libmyproxy-voms might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install libmyproxy-voms Using apt-get

To install libmyproxy-voms using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install libmyproxy-voms.

sudo apt-get -y install libmyproxy-voms

Install libmyproxy-voms Using Synaptic

To install libmyproxy-voms using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install libmyproxy-voms on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for libmyproxy-voms. This will display the libmyproxy-voms package in the package window, now to install libmyproxy-voms, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the libmyproxy-voms package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of libmyproxy-voms.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install libmyproxy-voms Using aptitude

To install libmyproxy-voms on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of libmyproxy-voms.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install libmyproxy-voms using the command aptitude install libmyproxy-voms.

sudo aptitude -y install libmyproxy-voms

How to Upgrade libmyproxy-voms on debian

If you want to upgrade the libmyproxy-voms package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade libmyproxy-voms using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade libmyproxy-voms to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade libmyproxy-voms.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade libmyproxy-voms sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade libmyproxy-voms

Upgrade libmyproxy-voms using Aptitude

To upgrade libmyproxy-voms using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade libmyproxy-voms.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade libmyproxy-voms

Upgrade libmyproxy-voms using Synaptic

To upgrade libmyproxy-voms using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for libmyproxy-voms, now right-click libmyproxy-voms, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade libmyproxy-voms just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall libmyproxy-voms on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall libmyproxy-voms from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just libmyproxy-voms, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove libmyproxy-voms

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of libmyproxy-voms

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of libmyproxy-voms you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge libmyproxy-voms

Remove libmyproxy-voms using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall libmyproxy-voms using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for libmyproxy-voms, right-click the libmyproxy-voms package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall libmyproxy-voms click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install libmyproxy-voms on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade libmyproxy-voms using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of libmyproxy-voms then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
